dialogues.text: Gracias, sefior. Muchas! The pickup truck drives away. The great gates open before us. Chace walks up the deeply sloping driveway, his shirt damp with sweat. Finally, he reaches the crest of the hil -- and stops.

dialogues.speaker: CHACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'll be damned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, on this hill, J Paul Getty supervises the construct of a precise replica of Hadrian's Villa, complete with reflecting pool and Roman statuary.

dialogues.speaker: GETTY
dialogues.text: Chace. You're looking damp. What happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: CHACE
dialogues.text: Car-pooling.

dialogues.speaker: GETTY
dialogues.text: It'll never catch on.  105. Chace stands marveling at the sprawling Villa.

dialogues.speaker: GETTY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's an exact replica of my Imperial Villa, down to the last detail, but with flush toilets. The mountain may not have come to Mohammed, but it sure as hell came to me. Getty's Secretary approaches.

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY
dialogues.text: West Texas Intermediate, sir. Getty glances at the ticker tape.

dialogues.speaker: CHACE
dialogues.text: What does it feel like, reading that slip of paper?

dialogues.speaker: GETTY
dialogues.text: Vertigo. For a moment, money loses all meaning and becomes as plentiful as air. Like... flight. But then it passes. Getty folds the paper and slips it into his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: GETTY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's all this I see on TV with Gail? Paying the ransom in full? We both know she doesn't have it.

dialogues.speaker: CHACE
dialogues.text: The lady's made other arrangements.

dialogues.speaker: GETTY
dialogues.text: She doesn't have the money. What's going on? Come on, where'd she get it? Is she fucking somebody? Chace stares at the old man.

dialogues.speaker: CHACE
dialogues.text: I think I'm finally beginning to understand what makes you tick.

dialogues.speaker: GETTY
dialogues.text: You couldn't begin to. Now spill it. What's going on? What's her game? Chace begins to walk away.  106.

dialogues.speaker: GETTY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't forget, Chace. I have a contract. And I'll enforce it.

dialogues.speaker: CHACE
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: GETTY
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: CHACE
dialogues.text: Because whatever personal security you presently enjoy comes from me. Those Alsatians limping around the pool? My people trained them. Your security system? My people installed it. Your bodyguards? Uh-huh. You're protected from every threat imaginable, unless that threat happens to be me.

dialogues.speaker: GETTY
dialogues.text: I suppose this is your way of submitting your resignation.

dialogues.speaker: CHACE
dialogues.text: "Men of risk." Isn't that what you called us? "I risk my money, you risk your life." (laughs) You and me -- we never risked a thing in our lives. We never took the chances ordinary people take. That's why we are what we are now. Chace turns to go. Getty grabs his arm.

dialogues.speaker: GETTY
dialogues.text: Those children are my blood, Chace. They were mine. And she took them. I was left with nothing. The old man's eyes brim with tears. Chace stares at him, and beyond him, at the palace filled with treasures.

dialogues.speaker: CHACE
dialogues.text: Now you know. Chace walks away, down the hill, leaving Getty behind. As he walks through the great iron gates, a cool spray from Pacific shimmers through the trees. Chace walks down to the end of the driveway, puts on his sunglasses, and holds out his thumb to hitch a ride.  107.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We FLY OVER the same streets of Rome where the movie bega

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chace emerges from the terminal. Iacovoni is waiting ther for him; he falls into step beside Chace as they exit.

dialogues.speaker: IACOVONI
dialogues.text: The money came through. We were on the phone, and my secretary begins to shout the bank wire came through. (a beat) It was the full ransom. $3.3 million at today's exchange rate. $1.6 billion in lira. Chace misses a step, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: IACOVONI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What did you say to him?

dialogues.speaker: CHACE
dialogues.text: I couldn't even tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nearly a dozen female BANK EMPLOYEES count out and bundle huge piles of lira notes at a great counting table.

dialogues.speaker: CINQUANTA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The money must be in used lira notes, small denomination only, no marking. A PHOTOCOPIER flashes as each note is photographed. The money is a 201-pound mountain. It is packed into three hu canvas MAIL BAGS and loaded onto a rolling pallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The streets of Rome are COMPLETELY, EERILY EMPTY. No cars

dialogues.speaker: CINQUANTA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Because of the fuel crisis rationing measures, no cars will be allowed on the roads on Sunday. Chace fills up a 10-liter can of gasoline at a gas statio He counts out a stack of lira notes for the owner.

dialogues.speaker: CINQUANTA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This way the autostrada will be empty. They will know if Gail is followed.  108.

dialogues.speaker: CHACE
dialogues.text: I'll make the exchange on my own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chace is on the phone, with Gail, Del Rovere, Corvo, and surveillance officer in the BG.

dialogues.speaker: CINQUANTA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Signora Getty only.

dialogues.speaker: CHACE
dialogues.text: She's not going.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: I can do it. I'm doing it.

dialogues.speaker: DEL ROVERE
dialogues.text: Signora, be reasonable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With dozens of paparazzi outside her building, Gail ascen the stairwell to the rooftop, crosses to another building and descends to a car at street level on an adjacent bloc

dialogues.speaker: CHACE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: She'll be in a car with millions of dollars. The whole world knows what she looks like. She could be robbed on the highway.

dialogues.speaker: CINQUANTA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That's your problem.

dialogues.speaker: CHACE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Then we both go. Non-negotiable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gail drives, with Chace in the passenger seat. The trunk the vehicle is weighed down by the money.

dialogues.speaker: CINQUANTA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Driving a Fiat 123 with two suitcases tied to the roof, exit the autostrada toll gate at 9AM and drive south at exactly 80 kilometers an hour. Their car slowly makes its way on the vast, empty autostr

dialogues.speaker: CINQUANTA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Don't stop for food, gas, toilet, nothing. Remember they are watching.  109. As they drive they glimpse isolated FIGURES standing at t edge of the highway: SENTRIES posted by the N'dragheta.

dialogues.speaker: CINQUANTA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: A handful of gravel will strike your windshield. This will be their sign. They enter the mountains; a FOG shrouds everything.

dialogues.speaker: CINQUANTA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Obey these rules or they will take his other ear, his eyes, a hand. A FISTFUL OF GRAVEL peppers their windshield. Chace crane his neck to see who threw it and glimpses a figure by the roadside darting back into the trees. Gail pulls over. The highway is empty. It's unclear what they should do next. Then Gail sees him:

dialogues.speaker: A YOUNG BOY
dialogues.text: standing by the roadside, shadowed in the mist a hundred yards away. Gail runs toward him...

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: Paul -- ! ...-but then she slows. The boy is not Paul. It's a 12-ye old mafia wannabe smoking a cigarette, waiting. A messeng

dialogues.speaker: ROADSIDE KID
dialogues.text: Lasciare i soldi. Leave the money. Drive on to the gas station and wait for our call while we count it. The kid turns and vanishes into the forest.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: THE BAGS OF MONEY by the side of the road. As Chace drive away we glimpse the shadows of men emerging from the fore -- then CUT TO an AERIAL VIEW of the scene as viewed from POLICE SURVEILLANCE AIRPLANE high above. In an instant, t mail bags are whisked away into the forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closed. A cardboard sign on the pump reads "NIENTE BENZIN NO GAS." Gail pulls up in front of a battered pay phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mail bags are unzipped. The bricks of lira are broken down and counted by hand, all under Saverio Mammoliti's e  110. We recognize the woman from Mammoliti's factory among the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul Getty rides in back, along with Cinquanta and Sgro. is dressed in brand-new clothes. Cinquanta brushes him of

dialogues.speaker: CINQUANTA
dialogues.text: That's better. You can't go home to your mother looking like a sciattone.

dialogues.speaker: SGRO
dialogues.text: I still say we should have cut his tongue out, just to be safe. The truck stops. Cinquanta pulls a ski mask over the boy' head backwards, so as to blindfold him.

dialogues.speaker: SGRO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Walk twenty paces, then stop and wait. We're watching. Take the mask off and we'll kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck's rear doors open next to a concrete drain pipe As Cinquanta helps Paul out of the truck he whispers:

dialogues.speaker: CINQUANTA
dialogues.text: Bona fortuna, Paolo.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: You too. The boy starts walking blindly along the highway. The doo close and the truck drives away, leaving Paul behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone RINGS. Gail picks up. Chace starts the car.

dialogues.speaker: CINQUANTA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Three kilometers down the autostrada is a drain pipe. Paul waits there for you. Get him out of Italy as fast as you can, I beg you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck is gone. Paul waits a moment, then pulls off th mask. There's no one around. There's a town in the distan AERIAL VIEW: CARABINERI POLICE CARS have begun to converg on the scene from nearby villages. SEARCH TEAMS with dogs comb the forest. The are encircling the area.  111.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The money is stacked, bundled, zipped into the mailbags, loaded onto a truck. Saverio Mammoliti hands out envelope of cash to each of his employees, including Cinquanta.

dialogues.speaker: CINQUANTA
dialogues.text: Grazie, Signore. In the distance, we hear DOGS BARKING. Mammoliti stops:

dialogues.speaker: MAMMOLITI
dialogues.text: Cane. Molti. Polizia. Tradimento. Mammoliti climbs into his waiting Mercedes. To his men:

dialogues.speaker: MAMMOLITI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tornare indietro e prendere il ragazzo. (subtitled) Go back and get the boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy is gone. Gail is still, silent, frightened.

dialogues.speaker: CHACE
dialogues.text: Footprints.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: He's not here, Chace.

dialogues.speaker: CHACE
dialogues.text: They made the drop. Chace frantically searches the snow on the hillside.

dialogues.speaker: CHACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Paul's a smart kid. What would you do? You wouldn't wait here for them to change their minds. Then he finds it, tossed into the drain pipe: the ski mas

dialogues.speaker: CHACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He ran. Chace looks down the highway, until he sees it on a nearb hilltop: the medieval-looking village of LAGONEGRO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J Paul Getty wakes from his slumber with a start.  112.

dialogues.speaker: GETTY
dialogues.text: Who's there? Getty is in a bedroom decorated in the ancient Roman styl A great log fire burns in the fireplace. Getty sits up in bed; the room is unfamiliar to him. Ther a strangeness to his surroundings, as if the old man has come unmoored, "2001"-like, in time. One side of Getty's face has gone completely slack: he's obviously suffered a stroke in the night. He steps into h slippers and shuffles along the marble floors in his paja

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- into a granite corridor peopled by stone figures from another age. He has no idea where he is.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL GETTY
dialogues.text: as he runs into the eerie, cobblestoned village of Lagone We can hear the DOGS BARKING in the distance: the police cordon has encircled the village and is drawing closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul wanders into the shop, his head covered in bandages.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Please let me in. Rifugio, prego. They're after me. The Barber slowly pushes Paul backwards, out of his shop.

dialogues.speaker: BARBER
dialogues.text: Non posso coinvolto. I can't get involved.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: My name is Paul Getty. I was kidnapped.

dialogues.speaker: BARBER
dialogues.text: I know who you are. The Barber locks the front door and pulls down the blind.

dialogues.speaker: THE N'DRAGHETA
dialogues.text: stalk through the street in their black suits, four abrea Cinquanta trails along. The villagers avoid eye contact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hurries through twilight streets, calling Paul's name.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: Scusi. Have you seen a teenage boy, curly hair, American -- The VILLAGERS turn away from her and hurry into their hom

dialogues.speaker: PAUL GETTY
dialogues.text: knocks on front doors, one after another. The people insi draw their curtains shut.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Rifugio, Prego! Let me in, please!

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER CHACE
dialogues.text: walks on the opposite side of the square from Gail, casti quick glances down hushed, narrow alleyways. He makes eye contact with one of the N'Dragheta. A look passes between them. Chace hurries on. He dares not call out Paul's name. He pats himself down, searching for a gun that isn't there. kicks a loose cobblestone and picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: THE CARABINERI
dialogues.text: move through the streets, conducting a house-to-house sea

dialogues.speaker: PAUL GETTY
dialogues.text: rounds a corner, glimpses the Carabineri, and backs away fearfully. He ducks down a narrow street.

dialogues.speaker: CHACE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Paul. Paul turns: Fletcher Chace stands at the end of the stree

dialogues.speaker: CHACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm here to take you home. At that moment, Paul is grabbed from behind by the N'drag The N'dragheta drags him backwards, round the corner -- -- and there's a THUD of skull on stone. The N'dragheta goes down, and we REVEAL Cinquanta standing behind him, h struck him with a cobblestone. Chace steps forward and brings his own stone down on the N'dragheta. They kick him until he stops moving. They sta together over the body. Chace looks at Cinquanta.  114.

dialogues.speaker: CHACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's you.

dialogues.speaker: CINQUANTA
dialogues.text: What are you looking at? Go. Chace drops his stone, turns, and sees Gail in the alley: she's witnessed everything. She grabs Paul by the arm and hurries him to their car. Chace starts the Fiat -- -- and they drive away, out of the village. Already, the Carabineri are apprehending the N'dragheta. A Carabineri sees Chace's car coming and calls out:

dialogues.speaker: CARABINERI
dialogues.text: Arresto! Attenzione! But he blows right by. The car descends the mountain and vanishes into the mists of the valley and beyond, to Rome

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getty wanders the halls of his mansion, his gait unsteady Marble emperors gaze down at him with their lightless eye Getty shuffles on, until he finds his prized painting -- Albrecht Diirer's "Madonna and Child in a Window." He rea and takes it from the wall -- -- and the silent alarm goes off. The doors at either end of the hallway SLAM SHUT, and the power cuts out. DARKNESS. The corridor is illuminated by the flames from fireplace. The shadows of dead emperors dance along the w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Fiat makes its way back to Rome along the serpentine highway, its headlights blazing. Chace drives; Gail and Paul sit in the back seat, silent apart, still recovering from what they've just endured. We see the LIGHTS of Rome in the distance. But then we realize that the lights are from TV cameras. The Italian press has paid off the people at the toll gat They've formed a gauntlet of TV and still cameras to forc the car to stop so they can get a photograph of Paul. Instead, Chace hits the gas and blows through the toll ga The paparazzi are forced to scramble and chase them.  115.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getty sits down before the fire. For the first time we ge a good look at the painting: a mother and her child. A go crown floats suspended above the mother's head.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: A Getty is special. A tear rolls down Getty's melted cheek. The painting fall from his hand and CLATTERS to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Coliseum of Rome comes into view, Paul breaks down Gail reaches for him and the boy crumbles into her arms.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: A Getty has a destiny. The paparazzi on their scooters catch up with the car. Ch looks into the rearview mirror: for the first and only ti in the movie, Gail is in tears.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We aren't like you. Chace flips the mirror down, giving Gail and Paul their solitude, then puts the pedal down and leaves the reporte in the dust.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But we were once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, Gail and Chace ascend the steps of the Questura, surrounded by clamoring reporters.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But I had an idea that maybe we could be again, me and my dad and my grandfather, if only we could get back to our own world where the force of gravity wasn't so strong. We could be together, like we used to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Squadra Mobile officer reaches under Paul's bed and fin a young boy's suitcase. He zips it open --

dialogues.speaker: PAUL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It was just an idea I had, a joke I told my friends: what if we gave it all away?  116. -- and inside are hundreds of letters, all addressed to J Paul Getty and pleading for money. Paul saved them all, rather than sending them Getty's response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul makes his official testimony to Del Rovere.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I guess somebody must have overheard me. And once it was out there I couldn't stop it. It wasn't a plan or anything. It was just a wish. A stupid kid's dream. Now I know nothing like that could never happen. I'm not a kid anymore. And with that, the tape recorder STOPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gail waits in the lobby of Getty Oil.

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ma'am? They'll see you now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gail enters the same board room. Oswald Hinge and the oth attorneys are there; they all rise, smiling as Gail enter The only empty chair is that of J Paul Getty himself.

dialogues.speaker: HINGE
dialogues.text: Ms Getty, we offer our sincerest condolences.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: For what? She looks at the empty chair.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh. You're very thoughtful.

dialogues.speaker: HINGE
dialogues.text: Please, sit. Mr Getty's death has created a bit of a crisis here. You see, Mr. Getty never groomed a successor. Or rather he tried to --  117.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: But he destroyed them all. (off his look) I don't think he planned on dying. He thought that was negotiable, too.

dialogues.speaker: HINGE
dialogues.text: Yes, well. As a result, the Getty estate has become a family fortune in search of a family.

dialogues.speaker: TAX ATTORNEY
dialogues.text: You see, the estate was structured as a charitable family trust.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: Did he ever give any money to charity?

dialogues.speaker: HINGE
dialogues.text: No. The trust enabled Mr. Getty to build his fortune without paying taxes. The problem is, the trust has rules. It throws off interest. The interest must be spent. It's a staggering amount of money.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: What do you want from me?

dialogues.speaker: HINGE
dialogues.text: How do I put this. The King is dead, and the throne is vacant. Someone has to take his place.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: That money destroyed my family.

dialogues.speaker: HINGE
dialogues.text: So you don't want it. We HOLD on Gail. Then:

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: No. Give it to me. The other attorney slides a stack of documents toward her Atop the stack is the beautiful gold fountain pen that sh used to sign her children away. She twists off the cap. The nib is as sharp as a knife. She sets it down and signs on the dotted line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The iron gates open before us, and a CROWD enters the gro They wear sneakers, jeans, t-shirts.  118. They snap pictures with Instamatic cameras and carry cans soda. Fletcher Chace is among them, his suit freshly pressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chace sits in a lobby chair, waiting for his appointment.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL'S SIGNATURE
dialogues.text: scrolls across the signature line of a bank check. She si at Getty's old Louis XIV desk, her bearing modest but som regal: she has become Getty, after her own fashion. She tears the check from the register and offers it to Chace.

dialogues.speaker: CHACE
dialogues.text: I can't accept this.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: It's not enough. Take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk together, a bit awkwardly, on the main terrace, where they pass a row of marble busts of Roman Emperors. The last bust in line is that of Getty himself. They pass DOCENT leading a tour group:

dialogues.speaker: DOCENT
dialogues.text: J Paul Getty believed deeply in the power of art to make us aware of our shared humanity, and that this legacy belonged to every man and woman, rich or poor. It was his philanthropic vision that made this museum possible. Gail and Chace exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: CHACE
dialogues.text: Who wrote that?

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: I did. But let's keep that to ourselves. (a beat) We hope you'll be staying on, Mr. Chace, but we're a public foundation now, and the position doesn't pay what it did. And I know you had other ambitions. But still.  119.

dialogues.speaker: CHACE
dialogues.text: Guys like me don't get rich. I've realized that. We get sidetracked too easily.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: Shame.

dialogues.speaker: CHACE
dialogues.text: Not really. A moment. She struggles to find the right words.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: I think of you as our family.

dialogues.speaker: CHACE
dialogues.text: It's kind of you to say so, ma'am. They pass a tiny sculpture on a platform: the Minotaur. Chace doesn't even notice it.

dialogues.speaker: CHACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There were a couple things around the grounds I was meaning to see to.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: Of course. Don't let me keep you. Chace leaves Gail on the terrace. As she watches Chace go her son Paul joins her, his hair grown long now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chace uses a butcher's knife to cut a strip of meat from steak. He cuts the strip into cubes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chace opens a cage and one of Getty's Alsatians limps out Chace feeds the dog the steak, kneading its fur, whisperi in its ear. He clips a chain leash to the dog's choke col

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chace walks the dog to the open front gate. He grips the dog's chain in his clenched fist. They stand there at the gate as the outsiders stream past the dog BARKING its insistent warning to any and all who would dare come to do this family harm. BLACK OUT.
